SENT.plain: In this study we describe an autosomal dominant distal muscular dystrophy in a small Austrian family

The myopathy started in early adulthood with a slowly progressive weakness of the muscles of the anterior tibial compartment, followed by the long finger extensors and sternocleidomastoids in some family members
Histopathology showed fiber size variation and autophagic vacuoles
This disease pattern is similar to Laing distal myopathy, which has been described previously in only one other family
